meanings.definition: Drooping or sagging of an organ or part, especially the eyelid.
meanings.sent1: The ptosis of her eyelid made it hard for her to see properly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with ptosis after noticing her drooping eyelid.
meanings.sent3: The ptosis of the curtain made it look like it was winking at me!
meanings.sent4: The ptosis of the flower petals gave them a graceful, weeping appearance.
meanings.sent5: The ptosis of the tree branches created a beautiful, cascading effect in the garden.

meanings.definition: A prolapse or downward displacement of an organ or part.
meanings.sent1: The patient's ptosis required surgical intervention to correct the displacement.
meanings.sent2: The ptosis of the herniated disc was causing severe back pain.
meanings.sent3: The ptosis of the bookshelf made all the books slide down to one end!
meanings.sent4: The ptosis of the bridge's support beam was a warning sign of structural issues.
meanings.sent5: The ptosis of the mountain slope indicated a potential landslide danger.
